newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danske Bank to advise on Tele Dk.
newsitem.headline: Danske Bank to advise on Tele Dk.

text.p: Denmark's finance ministry on Wednesday appointed Den Danske Bank to join a committee of experts to discuss the future of partly-privatised telecommunications group Tele Danmark.

It said in a statement that Den Danske Bank, Denmark's largest bank, would participate as financial advisor in the working group, also comprising representatives of the research and finance ministries.

The working group, whose formation the ministry announced originally on January 31, is to assess the value of the Danish state's 51 percent holding in the telecoms group and issue a report in late 1997.
The ministry says that setting up the committee is not a direct prelude to further privatisation of Tele Danmark, but market sources are nonetheless betting on a selloff next year.
Tele Danmark was partly privatised in 1994 and the government has said earlier that it did not intend to retain its holding permanently. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
